roleset.name: put into bed (can be metaphorical)
roleset.note: BED-V NOTES: Frames file for 'bed' based on sentences in ECTB2. Verbnet entry pocket-9.10.Created by Jena (from bed.02-v predicate notes)
BEDDING-N NOTES: Corresponds with bed.02. Framed by anwen april 2011. Often metaphorical. Not referring to blankets/comforters type of 'bedding'. (from bedding.01-n)

example.name: I still don't feel like this is a verb, but ok.
bed-v: metaphorical, all args
example.text: ...they bedded the brick in mortar and flashed the brick on the ends with mortar and troweled in behind the bricks with mortar.

example.name: bedding-n
example.text: Their bedding the pears in lettuce impressed the food critic.

roleset.name: put oneself to bed
roleset.note: BED_DOWN-V NOTES: Frames file for 'bed down' based on sentences in brown. (from bed.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: bed_down-v: the one example
example.text: when...you can't eat until he's bedded down for the night, hunger can be a gnawing torture.
